item.description:
Cinema City at the Palace has released the next few weekends' schedule for Cinema Classics. These movies cost only $5 per ticket ($4 for Criterion Club members) and show at 11:00am on Saturday and Sunday. I will choose one of the days and if you can't go on that day and want to go the other day, feel free.  The start time is always 10:45am because they show the movies promptly at 11:00am with no trailers.  Saturday is supposed to be rainy, perfect day to stay inside and see a classic film on the big screen!

 

You can get information about any of the films by going to their website and scrolling over the poster:  http://www.bowtiecinemas.com/cine-classics-plaza.php

 

If you have not seen "North by Northwest" on a big screen, you really need to do it.  The scale adds tension to several key scenes.  Hitchcock's 1959 film, starring Cary Grant, Eva Marie Saint, James Mason, and others, tells the story of "middle-aged Madison Avenue advertising executive Roger O. Thornhill [who] is mistaken for a government agent by a gang of spies. He gets involved in a series of misadventures and is pursued across the States by both the spies and the government whilst being helped by a beautiful blonde."  Which is rather like describing 'Psycho' as "Marion Crane checks into a hotel while on the lam."
